file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-31-04-04 - PASSENGER LOUDSPEAKERS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER LOUDSPEAKERS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install: • The loudspeakers in the PSUs; • The loudspeaker in the service-door region ceiling; • The loudspeaker over the attendant seat. B. To remove and install the lavatory loudspeaker, refer to AMM TASK 23-33-01-000-801-A/400 and AMM TASK 23-33-01-400-801-A/400, respectively. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER LOUDSPEAKER - REMOV- ALL 23-31-04-000-801-A AL PASSENGER LOUDSPEAKER - INSTAL- ALL 23-31-04-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 23-31-04 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-31-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PASSENGER LOUDSPEAKER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove: • The loudspeakers in the PSUs; • The loudspeaker in the ceiling at the service door region; • The loudspeaker over the attendant seat. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801-A/400 FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the PA circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. J. Removal SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) To remove the loudspeakers of the PSUs, do as follows (Figure 401): NOTE: These steps are applicable to all PSUs. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-31-04 Page 2 of 8 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Push the latch assembly (7) to open the PSU. (b) Carefully remove the loudspeaker insulator (1). (c) Carefully disconnect the electric terminals (2). (d) Remove the screws (6) and washers (5). NOTE: When you remove the loudspeaker (3), be careful not to drop the loudspeaker filler (4). (e) Remove the loudspeaker (3). (2) To remove the loudspeaker in the service-door region ceiling, do as follows (Figure 402): (a) Remove the service-door region ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/ 400). (b) Carefully remove the loudspeaker insulator (6). (c) Carefully disconnect the electric terminals (1). (d) Remove the screws (5) and washers (4). NOTE: When you remove the loudspeaker (2) , be careful not to drop the loudspeaker grill (3). (e) Remove the loudspeaker (2). (3) To remove the loudspeaker over the attendant seat, do as follows (Figure 403): (a) Remove the shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801-A/400). (b) Remove the screws (5), washers (4), nuts (2). NOTE: When you remove the loudspeaker (1), be careful not to drop the loudspeaker grill (3). (c) Remove the loudspeaker (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-31-04 Page 3 of 8 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

WASHER (4) 5. SCREW (4) DET. C 145AMM230235.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-31-04 Page 6 of 8 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-31-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. PASSENGER LOUDSPEAKER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install: • The loudspeakers in the PSUs; • The loudspeaker in the ceiling at the service door region; • The loudspeaker over the attendant seat. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION PASSENGER CABIN LOUDSPEAKER - OPERATION- AMM TASK 23-31-00-700-803-A/500 AL CHECK AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400 FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) 3M Fast Bond X-30 AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) To install the loudspeakers of the PSUs, do as follows (Figure 401): (a) Put the loudspeaker filler (4) in position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-31-04 Page 7 of 8 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Put the loudspeaker (3) in position. (c) Install the screws ( 6) and washers (5). (d) Carefully connect the electric terminals (2). (e) Carefully apply the 3M Fast Bond X-30 to the loudspeaker insulator (1). (f) Install the loudspeaker insulator (1). (g) Close the PSU. (2) To install the loudspeaker in the ceiling at the service door region, do as follows (Figure 402): (a) Put the loudspeaker grill (3) in position. (b) Put the loudspeaker (2) in position. (c) Install the screws (5) and washers (4). (d) Carefully connect the electric terminals (1). (e) Carefully apply the 3M Fast Bond X-30 to the loudspeaker insulator (6). (f) Install the loudspeaker insulator (6). (g) Install the service-door region ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/ 400). (3) To install the loudspeaker over the attendant seat, do as follows (Figure 403): (a) Put the loudspeaker grill (3) in position. (b) Put the loudspeaker (1) in position. (c) Install the screws (5), washers (4) and nuts (2). (d) Install the shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the PA circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it. (2) Do the Passenger-Cabin Loudspeaker Operational Check ( AMM TASK 23-31-00-700-803-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-31-04 Page 8 of 8 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
